citations.narrative:
While the facility is in daily communication with their attending veterinarian and the veterinarian regularly monitors their
animal population on a routine basis through telemedicine and conferencing opportunities, visual examinations of the
marine mammals did not occur on a semiannual basis for the 2023 calendar year. The consulting veterinarian conducted
visual exams of the three Californian sea lions in March of 2023. When asked when the second visual exam was
conducted for that year, the facility representative informed the inspector that photographs of each sea lion are sent to the
online portal that both the attending and consulting veterinarians have access too. The photographs were utilized in lieu of
visual exams occurring on-site.
Visual exams performed under the direction of the attending veterinarian provide a real-time assessment of each marine
mammals’ health condition and status, affording more observation opportunities in comparison to remote or virtual
alternatives for exams. All marine mammals must be visually examined at least semiannually and must be physically
examined under the supervision of and when determined to be necessary by the attending veterinarian.
Correct by May 31, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives and facility president.
n

narrative:
3.110(f) 
   
Veterinary care. 
While the facility is in daily communication with their attending veterinarian and the veterinarian regularly monitors their 
animal population on a routine basis through telemedicine and conferencing opportunities, visual examinations of the 
marine mammals did not occur on a semiannual basis for the 2023 calendar year. The consulting veterinarian conducted 
visual exams of the three Californian sea lions in March of 2023. When asked when the second visual exam was 
conducted for that year, the facility representative informed the inspector that photographs of each sea lion are sent to the 
online portal that both the attending and consulting veterinarians have access too. The photographs were utilized in lieu of 
visual exams occurring on-site. 
Visual exams performed under the direction of the attending veterinarian provide a real-time assessment of each marine 
mammals’ health condition and status, affording more observation opportunities in comparison to remote or virtual 
alternatives for exams. All marine mammals must be visually examined at least semiannually and must be physically 
examined under the supervision of and when determined to be necessary by the attending veterinarian. 
Correct by May 31, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives and facility president.
